The Clerk (Mr. Diaz) announced the presence of a quorum.

Reports of Standing Committees
Report of the Committee on State and Federal Legislation

State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Padavan, S. 8705, and by the Committee on Rules (at the request of Assembly Member Silver), A. 11755, “AN ACT to amend the real property tax law, in relation to tax abatement and tax exemption for industrial and commercial work on properties in a city of one million or more persons”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Tax abatement/ exemption on commercial work (S.8705/A.11755)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Smith, S. 8289-A, and Assembly Member Pheffer, A. 11222-A, “AN ACT in relation to authorizing the city of New York to sell waterfront property and land under water appurtenant thereto, owned by such city, consisting of a tax lot improved with a pier in the county of Queens, known as Beach 84th Street Pier”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Padavan, Golden, Lanza and Maltese, S. 6366-A, and by the Committee on Rules (at the request of Assembly Members Silver and Farrell), A. 11586, “AN ACT to amend the real property tax law, in relation to tax abatement for industrial and commercial work on properties in a city of one million or more persons”.

State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Lanza, S.7024-B, and Assembly Members Cusick, Eddington, Wright, Kellner, Peralta, et al, A.10119-C, “AN ACT to amend the general business law and the executive law, in relation to the licensing of security guards and the business of watch, guard or patrol agency and the registry thereof”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Licensing of security guards and the business of watch, guard or patrol agency and the registry thereof.  (S.7024-B/A.10119-C)

Items.Title: The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called the Recessed Meeting to order.

Items.MinutesNote: At this point the Speaker (Council Member Quinn) made the following annoucements:
Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Quinn), the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Meeting in recess.

Editor's Note: These proceedings are the Recessed Council Meeting of June 12, 2008 held on June 23, 2008.  This is a continuation of the Stated Council Meeting that was held on June 12, 2008.  Consistent within the nature of a recessed meeting, Council Members who were not present and did not vote at the Stated Council Meeting held on June 12, 2008, may now be considered present for that Meeting and may now be allowed the opportunity to vote on the items Coupled on the General Order Calendar of June 12.  Council Members Baez, Mendez and Weprin, being present at this Recessed Meeting held on June 23, 2008, are now thereby considered present for the proceedings of the Stated Council Meeting of June 12, 2008.  Council Member Weprin chose to vote on the items Coupled on the General Order Calendar of June 12 at this Recessed Meeting held on June 23, 2008.

Update: At this Recessed Meeting held on June 23, 2008, Council Members Barron, Gioia, James, Katz, Mealy, Vacca, and Vann were not present.
At the continuation of the June 12, 2008 Stated and the 6-23-2008 Recessed Meeings held on June 29, 2008, Council Members Barron, Gioia, James, Katz, and Vann
chose to take the opportunity to vote affirmative on the items coupled on the Supplemental Roll Call on General Orders for the June 23, 2008 Recessed Council Meeting.  Council Members Mealy dis note vote and are now marked as Present but Not Voting for the June 23, 2008 Recessed.  

With this in mind, the revised June 23 Suplemental General Orders vote Roll Call now stands at 49-0-0, with 2 Present but Not Voting with the exceptions of SLRs 127 and 129 that both have a revised vote of 45-4-0 with 2 Present but Not Voting.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Padavan, Golden, Lanza and Maltese, S. 6366-A, and by the Committee on Rules (at the request of Assembly Members Silver and Farrell), A. 11586, “AN ACT to amend the real property tax law, in relation to tax abatement for industrial and commercial work on properties in a city of one million or more persons”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.

Items.MinutesNote: The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The revised Supplemental General Order vote is 49-0-0 with 2 Council Members Present but Not Voting (original June 23 vote: 44-0-0)

The following files were removed from the Supplemental Roll Call for General Orders  and were voted separately:

SLR No. 127, (original June 23 vote: 40-4-0)--revised vote 45-4-0 with 2 CMs Present but Not Voting
SLR No. 129, (original June 23 vote: 40-4-0)--revised vote 45-4-0 with 2 CMs Present but Not Voting

(see notes under the Roll Call for Attendance section of these Minutes)

See files for individual votes.
Recessed Meeting of June 12, 2008 held on June 23, 2008
